meanings.definition: The state or quality of being faint or lacking in strength.
meanings.sent1: The faintnesses of the old man made it hard for him to climb stairs.
meanings.sent2: She felt faintnesses after running for a long time without a break.
meanings.sent3: The faintnesses of the kitten trying to meow loudly was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The faintnesses of the dying fire resembled the fading hope in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The faintnesses of the pencil marks on the paper were barely visible.

meanings.definition: A feeling of dizziness or lightheadedness.
meanings.sent1: The spinning carousel caused a wave of faintnesses in the children.
meanings.sent2: His sudden rise from the chair left him with a sense of faintnesses.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected news brought a strange bout of faintnesses to her mind.
meanings.sent4: The height of the mountain induced a strange sense of faintnesses in him.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the bakery filled her with a pleasant faintnesses.

meanings.definition: A slight or barely perceptible quality or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The faintnesses of the outline made it hard to distinguish the shape.
meanings.sent2: In the dim light, the faintnesses of the painting were hard to appreciate.
meanings.sent3: The faintnesses of the distant music added a mysterious touch to the night.
meanings.sent4: The faintnesses of the memory lingered in the back of his mind.
meanings.sent5: The faintnesses of the scent reminded her of a long-forgotten perfume.
